intro: Impatiens refracta, commonly known as the refracta impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that come in a range of colors, including pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, with upright stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its unique seed dispersal mechanism involves explosive capsules that release seeds upon touch.
